meta.title: Hamin Lee - Resume
meta.description: Full-stack engineer connecting web, on-device LLM, real-time streaming, and robotics into shippable products.
meta.portfolioDescription: Software 3.0 - The Era of LLM-Programmable Systems

hero.title: Full-Stack Engineer Hamin Lee
hero.description: Full-stack engineer connecting web, on-device LLM, real-time streaming, and robotics into shippable products.
hero.summary: Full-stack engineer connecting web, on-device LLM, real-time streaming, and robotics into shippable products. I specialize in bridging mobile on-device AI with real-time media/robotics through streaming and low-latency control, achieving both user experience and performance with privacy-centric architecture and PWA/edge deployment. I have experience launching and operating multiple projects with end-to-end ownership from product initialization to deployment/operation automation.

sections.projectsDescription: I've explored new technologies and realized ideas through various side projects.
sections.publicationsDescription: Books containing insights on technology and development.
sections.hackathonsDescription: Awards from various competitions and certifications I hold.

data.description: Full-stack engineer connecting web, on-device LLM, real-time streaming, and robotics into shippable products.
data.summary: Full-stack engineer connecting web, on-device LLM, real-time streaming, and robotics into shippable products. I specialize in bridging mobile on-device AI with real-time media/robotics through streaming and low-latency control, achieving both user experience and performance with privacy-centric architecture and PWA/edge deployment. I have experience launching and operating multiple projects with end-to-end ownership from product initialization to deployment/operation automation.

poul.title: CTO
poul.description: As lead engineer for the on-device LLM mobile app 'Llami App', I designed and implemented a WebView↔Native bridge architecture. Built on-device STT/TTS and image processing pipelines using ONNX Runtime, OpenCV, and MMKV, developed an AI-powered dashboard, and configured Supabase-based DB integration. For the web-based robot control 'Llami Robotics', I implemented UDP control protocol for DeepRobotics Lite3 and WebRTC low-latency streaming, and developed SLAM mapping UI and path planning operation UI. Independently developed the in-browser AI coding agent 'Curiosity', implementing a WebContainer+Monaco-based real-time code execution environment.

abacus.title: Full-Stack Developer
abacus.description: Developed a remote education platform using educational hardware. Built real-time chat and video conferencing solutions using WebRTC with Next.js and MobX. Constructed backend with Supabase (PostgreSQL) and Nest.js, deploying infrastructure on Railway. Participated in ESP-32-based hardware firmware development implementing web-based remote updates, and implemented installation-free communication between smart educational hardware and web browsers using Web Bluetooth technology.

metamorp.title: Full-Stack Developer
metamorp.description: Participated in developing a web-based 3D slicer program and platform. Developed components using React, SCSS (BEM), and MobX, implementing interaction-based Vector Animation. Developed backend using Nest.js, Prisma ORM, and TypeScript, deploying with AWS Beanstalk, Aurora DB, and Railway. Ported Electron-implemented programs to work on Intel Mac, Silicon Mac, and Linux, and built a real-time update deployment system for Electron apps by configuring a Redis-based Pub/Sub server.

toss.title: Web Automation Developer
toss.description: Joined the web automation team to develop scraping modules used in the identity verification process for Nonghyup Bank, Shinhan Bank, and Industrial Bank of Korea for the Toss app.

aha.title: Frontend Developer
aha.description: Participated in migrating Aha's knowledge-sharing platform service from Nuxt.js version 2 to version 3. Created and applied an open-source state management module called vue-state-store to the project. Participated in Next.js-based UI development for Aha Connects, an online consultation service, and was responsible for connecting the Sendbird-based chat system on the frontend.

rightcode.title: Full-Stack Developer
rightcode.description: Took full charge of hybrid app development and release process for Android and iOS. Developed an app that remotely operates sports EMS devices using BLE communication. Participated in configuring communication between hotel fire detectors and servers and building an administrator dashboard page. Developed a communication program between web browsers and POS receipt printers in a store order management system. Worked on crawling real-time stock information from the web and displaying it in real-time within the app using the TradingView library.

akaBrowser.description: Created an open-source browser based on the Chromium engine. It's a secondary browser concept that stays always on top without replacing the main browser, and completed beta release with Electron. Implemented encrypted content streaming playback for Netflix/Disney+/Prime Video based on Widevine DRM.

groundCodes.description: An open-source project with a coordinate-based address system that can specify any location in the world with just a region name and two words. Self-developed the Grok Spiral algorithm (O(√N) efficiency), consisting of a monorepo architecture with Google Maps API-based interactive web app, RESTful API server, and visualization demo app. Completed multilingual support and Cloudflare Pages deployment.

postRun.title: New Year's Greeting Mailbox
postRun.description: A project developed at a Hanghae99 event where you can create 3D New Year's greeting cards and add desired images to share. You can have New Year's greeting messages automatically written by LLM or automatically generate images with A.I. to use as card backgrounds. Won the Best Project Award.

fridayGPT.description: A project that assigns R&R to GPT to proceed with programming step by step. The AI recursively searches web pages and asks itself questions, going through each step until completing the code.

hanghae.title: Hanghae Plus: 2nd Coding Track Meet Best Project Award
hanghae.description: Won the Best Project Award with the 3D New Year's greeting card web app 'New Year's Greeting Mailbox' project.

socialVenture.title: Social Venture Idea Produce20 Excellence Award
socialVenture.description: Won the Excellence Award (KIST President's Award) in the Social Venture Idea Competition.

police.title: 4th National Police Agency Science Policing Idea Contest Excellence Award
police.description: Won the Excellence Award (KIST President's Award) in the National Police Agency Science Policing Idea Contest.

defense.title: Ministry of National Defense Creative Defense Idea Contest Excellence Award
defense.description: Won the Excellence Award (Minister of National Defense Award) in the Ministry of National Defense Creative Defense Idea Contest.
defense.win: Excellence Award (Minister of National Defense Award)

certification.title: Electronic Equipment Technician Certificate
certification.location: Human Resources Development Service of Korea
certification.description: Obtained the Electronic Equipment Technician Certificate.

cleanVibeCoding.title: Clean Vibe Coding
cleanVibeCoding.author: Hamin Lee
cleanVibeCoding.description: In an era where generative AI 'mass-produces code', a programmer's value is determined by the ability to maintain less code in a clearer structure and to define, verify, and communicate problems. This book is a practical guide that extends Dijkstra's structured programming and Robert C. Martin's Clean Code to today's AI collaboration environment.

mugunghwa.title: Base-72 Representation System in Korean Using Syllable Block System
mugunghwa.author: Hamin Lee
mugunghwa.description: Mimicking Base 32, which implements a 32-base system by mixing English and numbers, I created a 72-base encoding system in pure Korean, and proposed an algorithm that compresses GPS coordinates with a 3-meter error into five short Korean characters. Based on this paper, I developed a JavaScript-based open-source implementation called 'Mugunghwa Code' and released it on GitHub.

problem.title: Llami App Development Background
problem.subtitle: Business Problem Definition
problem.problem1: • 95% bounce rate on payment page
problem.problem2: • Customer interview: "Hesitant to pay due to many free AI services"
problem.problem3: • CAC 5x higher than investor requirements
problem.problem4: • Existing AI service cost reduction methods only suitable for large-scale services
problem.quote: "A new approach to dramatically reduce AI service fixed costs is required"

design.title: Llami App Design
design.subtitle: Requirements and Solutions
design.solution1: → Complete server cost elimination through on-device AI app design
design.requirement2: Requirement 2: App Development with Web Team
design.solution2: → Expo WebView + React Native/C++ hybrid design for core modules only
design.solution3: → Fine-tune Gemma3 SLM and deploy as GGUF model

implementation.title: Llami App Implementation
implementation.subtitle: Technical Challenges and Solutions
implementation.item1Detail1: • Observable State-based Expo ↔ React Native state sharing
implementation.item3Detail1: • iOS Metal GPU acceleration via llama.cpp
implementation.item4Detail1: • Web developers can develop without native knowledge
implementation.decision1: • Fast MVP with React components → Gradual React Native transition
implementation.decision2: • 60% code reduction through bridge pattern abstraction
implementation.decision3: • 50% build time reduction with EAS Build automation
implementation.decision4: • Type safety through Observable-based state management

results.title: Llami App Results
results.subtitle: Business Impact
results.business1: • Transformed technical constraints into business opportunities
results.business2: • Achieved zero fixed costs with on-device AI
results.business3: • Optimized deployment costs with Cloudflare R2
results.technical1: • Finding balance between fast development vs good design
results.technical3: • Choosing tech stack matching team capabilities

problem.title: Llami Robotics - Quadruped Robot
problem.subtitle: DeepRobotics Robot Dog Remote Control and Autonomous Navigation Platform
problem.contributionValue: Hamin Lee 50%: Development of DeepRobotics Lite3 robot dog remote control and autonomous navigation system. Robot control via WebRTC-based real-time video streaming and WebSocket communication, SLAM-based mapping and path planning algorithm implementation
problem.challenge1Title: Lack of Robot Web Communication Protocol
problem.challenge1Desc: DeepRobotics Lite3 uses UDP binary protocol, no official web SDK available
problem.challenge2Desc: RTSP stream cannot be played directly in web, HLS has 3~5 second delay
problem.challenge3Desc: Handling multi-layer constraints including obstacle avoidance, work area constraints, and preferred paths
problem.challenge4Desc: Unstable white balance from robot camera, CPU-based video processing causes frame drops at 30fps

design.title: Llami Robotics Design
design.subtitle: Key Design Decisions
design.detail1: Real-time transmission of robot control commands and status data
design.detail2: RTSP → H.264 RTP Transcoding → WebRTC Transmission
design.detail3: Real-time environment map generation based on LiDAR data
design.detail4: Optimal path search based on multi-layer cost map

implementation.title: Llami Robotics Implementation
implementation.subtitle: Technical Challenges and Solutions
implementation.challenge1Situation: Situation: Need to implement binary protocol directly without official SDK
implementation.challenge1Action: Action: Packet analysis with Wireshark, parsing 200+ bytes of robot status data
implementation.challenge1Impact: Impact: Achieved real-time bidirectional communication (500ms cycle)
implementation.challenge2Situation: Situation: RTSP cannot be played on web, HLS has 3~5 second delay
implementation.challenge2Action: Action: RTSP → H.264 RTP transcoding with FFmpeg, WebRTC transmission with mediasoup
implementation.challenge2Impact: Impact: Latency reduced from 3~5 seconds → 300~500ms (90% reduction)
implementation.challenge3Situation: Situation: Autonomous navigation needed in complex environments
implementation.challenge3Action: Action: Multi-layer cost map generation, A* algorithm with 8-directional neighbor search
implementation.challenge3Impact: Impact: Average 45ms path planning in 4000×4000 virtual world
implementation.challenge4Situation: Situation: CPU-based video processing causes frame drops
implementation.challenge4Action: Action: GPU acceleration with WebGL Fragment Shader
implementation.challenge4Impact: Impact: Real-time 30fps processing at 1920×1080 resolution, CPU usage below 5%

results.title: Llami Robotics Results
results.subtitle: Business Impact and Learnings
results.technical1: • Turborepo monorepo separating apps (web, motion-host, proxy)
results.technical2: • Reactive state management with LegendState Observable pattern
results.technical3: • Minimize CPU load with WebGL GPU acceleration
results.learning1: • Low-level UDP protocol implementation and binary data parsing experience
results.learning2: • WebRTC SFU architecture design and real-time streaming optimization
results.learning3: • Application of path planning algorithms to actual robot control

problem.title: aka-browser: Mini Browser Development
problem.subtitle: Project Overview and Background
problem.painPoint1: • Need for secondary browser without replacing main browser
problem.quote: "When viewing reference materials or watching videos while working, I needed a lightweight browser that could always stay on top without switching tabs in the main browser."

design.title: aka-browser Design
design.subtitle: System Architecture
design.decision2Detail1: • IPC channels: Main ↔ Renderer process separation
design.decision2Detail3: • Security validation: Sender verification in all IPC requests
design.decision3Detail1: • Inactive tabs: Stop rendering with removeChildView()
design.decision3Detail2: • LRU cache: Store theme colors for 100 domains

implementation.title: aka-browser Implementation
implementation.subtitle: Core Implementation Details
implementation.feature2Detail2: • Preview capture → Tab switch → Theme apply
implementation.challenge1Problem: Manual VMP signing required for every build
implementation.challenge1Solution: EVS signing automation with electron-builder afterPack hook
implementation.challenge2Problem: UI delay from theme color recalculation during tab switch
implementation.challenge2Solution: LRU cache stores theme colors for 100 domains
implementation.challenge3Problem: Sandbox must be disabled for DRM playback

results.title: aka-browser Results
results.subtitle: Project Achievements
results.learning1Detail: Netflix UA policy change → Domain-specific UA switch (2 hours)
results.learning2Detail: Widevine verification failure → EVS signing automation
results.learning3Detail: Static HTML → React TSX dynamic generation

problem.title: Curiosity Development Background
problem.subtitle: On-Premise AI Coding Platform for Rapid MVP Validation by Non-Developers
problem.problem1: • Outsourced development cost: Minimum $50K+, 2-3 months required
problem.problem2: • No-code tool limitations: No customization possible
problem.problem3: • Developer hiring: Labor cost burden in early-stage startups

design.title: Curiosity Design
design.subtitle: Requirements and Solutions
design.solution1: → Run Node.js environment in browser with WebContainer
design.solution2: → Recursive structure for AI to self-plan-execute-verify repeatedly
design.solution3: → Minimize external API dependencies, support closed network environments

implementation.title: Curiosity Implementation
implementation.subtitle: Technical Challenges and Solutions
implementation.feature1Detail1: • Maximize resource efficiency with singleton pattern
implementation.feature2Detail1: • Plan → Execute tools → Verify results → Replan
implementation.feature2Detail2: • Prevent infinite recursion: Pattern detection + max depth limit
implementation.feature4Detail1: • File read/write, command execution, web search, etc.
implementation.challenge2: • AI infinite recursion prevention (pattern detection algorithm)

results.title: Curiosity Results
results.subtitle: Business Impact and Achievements
results.architecture1: • Maximized resource efficiency with WebContainer singleton pattern
results.architecture2: • Simplified complex business logic with recursive structure
results.architecture3: • Scalable structure with client-server tool separation
results.balance1: • Solved infinite recursion risk with pattern detection
results.balance2: • Designed so individual tool failures don't halt entire flow
results.balance3: • Provided intuitive feedback understandable by non-developers
results.discontinued2: • External API dependency removal goal unmet
results.discontinued3: • Resource focus shifted to Llami App project
results.future2: • Complete standalone execution in closed networks
